Text: Nathan Kosiba
_No prerequisites required_
Population data can be specified by the user and treatment variable can be specified

Population data subset can be specified on user specified conditions
Population data created matches data subset as specified

Population groups can be added by combining existing groups
Header N counts of combined groups match the combined total of the groups

Verify treatment variable in layer is the same as specified when inherited from table
Population data and treatment variable can be specified independent of analysis data and treatment variable

Verify analysis data can be manually specified if not the same as population data

Verify analysis treatment variable can be manually specified if not the same as population treatment variable

Text: Distinct n and % can be displayed in a n (%) fashion and total counts can be added

Check that risk difference calculated between groupings is correct
Check that confidence interval calculated between groupings is correct
Arguments passed through to prop.test create the correct output
Risk difference can be calculated over user specified cols arguments
Risk difference estimate and confidence interval can be computed across values of the treatment variable and cols argument
Risk difference can be calculated over nested count layers and by variables

Check that the computed statistic value matches the value from the specified formula

Check the statistic values match the values from the specified grouping variable
